topic.title: Configuring Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager

abstract.shortdesc: Installation and configuration steps for your Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager.
abstract.p: Zoning is a fabric-based service in a Storage Area Network (SAN), which enables you to group host and storage nodes that need to communicate. Zoning allows nodes to communicates with each other if they are the member of the same zone.

supports Brocade FC Zone Manager. Block Storage (Cinder) needs to be configured to enable auto-zoning using Brocade FC Zone Manager. The following section describes the procedure to add Brocade Zone Manager configuration to cinder.conf.j2.
This page describes the configuration of Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager for the block storage.

section.title: Known Limitations
section.p: Following are the known limitation for this release:

ul.li:
- Existing volume detach fails after modifying the zoning_mode=fabric from none.
Due to this bug, you cannot change the zoning_mode post-installation. You must use either a preconfigured zone or auto_zoning with Brocade.
- Parallel volume attach to different compute host fails

If is configured to boot from SAN over Fibre Channel, all storage, controller and compute nodes must be zoned and active. In this configuration you should not configure the Block Storage Volume Operations (Cinder) service to use the Brocade Zone Manager. This applies whether you have configured Fibre Channel on a dedicated FC infrastructure or Fibre Channel over Ethernet.
Brocade switches must be installed in SAN.

li.p: Block Storage should be configured to use a Fibre Channel Volume Driver that supports Zone Manager. To enable Fibre Channel Zone Manager, you require the following cinder.conf.j2 configuration options.

section.title: Configure Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager
section.p: You must modify cinder.conf.j2 to update Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager Driver details.

Perform the following steps to configure Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager:
Login to lifecycle manager.
Change the directory as shown below:cd ~/helion
Edit cinder.conf.j2 file at my_cloud/config/cinder/cinder.conf.j2 to add Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Manager Driver data.
The values entered in step 4 is an example. You must change the value as per your requirement/environment.
To enable FCZM you must add zoning_mode=fabric to [DEFAULT] entry.
Brocade driver information is a new section added to the [fc-zone-manager] section. Fabric switch [Fabric_A] [Fabric_B] information is added in [device] section for each side of the fabric.
Copy the following configuration. The values in FABRIC_A and FABRIC_B are an example. [DEFAULT] zoning_mode=fabric
[fc-zone-manager] brcd_sb_connector=cinder.zonemanager.drivers.brocade.brcd_fc_zone_client_cli.BrcdFCZoneClientCLI fc_san_lookup_service=cinder.zonemanager.drivers.brocade.brcd_fc_san_lookup_service.BrcdFCSanLookupService zone_driver=cinder.zonemanager.drivers.brocade.brcd_fc_zone_driver.BrcdFCZoneDriver fc_fabric_names=FABRIC_A, FABRIC_B
[FABRIC_A] fc_fabric_address = 10.10.0.20 fc_fabric_user = admin fc_fabric_password = password principal_switch_wwn = 10:00:50:eb:1a:05:c5:5d zoning_policy = initiator-target fc_fabric_port = 22 zone_activate = true zone_name_prefix = FABRIC_A_
[FABRIC_B] fc_fabric_address = 10.10.0.21 fc_fabric_user = admin fc_fabric_password = password principal_switch_wwn = 10:00:50:eb:1a:05:c5:5e zoning_policy = initiator-target fc_fabric_port = 22 zone_activate = true zone_name_prefix = FABRIC_B_Please enter the values which are specific to your environment for FABRIC_A and FABRIC_B.
Commit your configuration to a local repository:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>" Enter your commit message <commit message>
Run the configuration processor:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.ymlWhile executing the above command, you are prompted to enter the encryption key. If you choose not to use one, just press Enter and proceed further.
Run the following command to create a deployment directory.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the following command to configure brocade zone manager. cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml
